QAPair.Question: What is (are) Neuroretinitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Neuroretinitis is inflammation of the retina and optic nerve of the eye. The condition can be caused by bacteria, viruses or autoimmune disease. It shares some features of optic neuritis . There is mostly central visual loss, which often recovers after some months, but often not completely. There is no treatment that has proven to be helpful.
